q: . In a call for increased bipartisanship, some members of Congress have proposed that both parties sit together at Barack Obama 's State of the Union address, which will take place on January 25. It's a symbol, said Democratic New York Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand , one of the champions of the plan. "You'll create an image of the Congress deciding that we are going to work as a body, not as two separate sides
